CLOSE MENU
Get Help Now
Call 9-1-1 if you have a medical emergency.
Call 9-8-8
Text 9-8-8
I need help now
Call
9-8-8
or 1-888-724-7240 to speak to a
 trained crisis specialist. They can help you find the help you need,
 or send the
Mobile
 Crisis Response Team
to your location. Support is free,
 confidential, and available in over 200 languages within seconds.
If you can take yourself somewhere safely, the facilities below have
 urgent walk-in services:
Crisis
 Stabilization Units
– six locations around the county open
 24/7, including
one
 for ages under 18
.
San
 Diego County Psychiatric Hospital
– located near Old Town,
 open 24/7.
Get
 directions
to this location or call
619-692-8232.
Behavioral
 Health Clinics
– find the closest clinic from 20 locations
 around the county, available during business hours.
I need to talk to someone
Life can be hard sometimes. If you or someone you know is
 struggling emotionally, experiencing an issue with drugs or alcohol,
 or having a hard time, dialing
9-8-8
can help. This 3-digit
 nationwide phone number can connect you to the
San
 Diego Access and Crisis Line
. Calling can connect you, a
 friend, or a family member to local mental health or substance use
 services and referrals. We don’t have to face these challenges alone.
Get free, confidential support now from an experienced counselor by:
Calling or texting
9-8-8
Calling 1-888-724-7240
Starting a chat
Learn more about
our
 crisis services
.
